meanings.definition: A boat used for towing other vessels.
meanings.sent1: The towboat helped pull the stranded ship to safety.
meanings.sent2: The towboat slowly dragged the barge along the river.
meanings.sent3: The towboat and the ship played a game of tug-of-war.
meanings.sent4: The towboat was a loyal companion to the ships in need.
meanings.sent5: The bright red towboat stood out against the blue water.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul a vessel using a towboat.
meanings.sent1: They decided to towboat the sailboat back to shore.
meanings.sent2: The captain carefully towboated the yacht out of the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to towboat their toy boats in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: She had to towboat the broken-down boat all the way to the dock.
meanings.sent5: The towboating process required patience and skill.
